work.name: Professor Jieran Wu, Zhejiang University
work.summary: The study aims to relax assumptions in macroeconomic models and build new models to describe how companies in production network are affected by incomplete information.
highlights: I am responsible for addressing the existence and uniqueness of solutions to the fixed-point equations.
The proof of existence has been accepted by the professor

work.name: New Momentum Asset Management
work.summary: Conducted research on Alpha factors using China’s A-share transaction data and companies’ financial results, primarily on distinguishing momentum and reversal effects, special event driven framework, and technical factors.
highlights: Completed three research reports on these three topics
contributed 16 significant Alpha factorswith low correlations that outperformed CSI 500 Index.

publications.name: ESG Rating Events, Financial Investment Behavior and Corporate Innovation
publications.summary: Taking Chinese A-share non-financial listed companies from 2009 to 2020 as research samples, this paper empirically studies the mechanism of ESG rating events affecting corporate innovation of listed companies.

projects.name: Multifactor Model
projects.summary: The research focused on machine learning algorithms and studied the application of decision trees(XGBoost), Neural Network and GANs in stock selection. The study analyzed stock transaction data,analysts’ forecasts, and fundamental financial data to construct 15 factors and train XGBoost modelfor fitting these factors.
